SEARCH
Package sh.brane.core.crypto.eip712

Record Class TypeDefinition<T>

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
sh.brane.core.crypto.eip712.TypeDefinition<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the Java type this definition maps
Record Components:
primaryType - the primary type name (e.g., "Permit", "Mail")
types - map of type names to their field definitions
extractor - function to extract field values from a message object
public record TypeDefinition<T>(String primaryType, Map<String,List<TypedDataField>> types, Function<T,Map<String,Object>> extractor) extends Record
Defines the EIP-712 type structure for a Java type.

This record encapsulates the primary type name, type definitions for all struct types, and a function to extract field values from a message object.

Example usage for ERC-2612 Permit: 


 record Permit(Address owner, Address spender, BigInteger value, BigInteger nonce, BigInteger deadline) {
     public static final TypeDefinition<Permit> DEFINITION = TypeDefinition.forRecord(
         Permit.class,
         "Permit",
         Map.of("Permit", List.of(
             TypedDataField.of("owner", "address"),
             TypedDataField.of("spender", "address"),
             TypedDataField.of("value", "uint256"),
             TypedDataField.of("nonce", "uint256"),
             TypedDataField.of("deadline", "uint256")
         ))
     );
 }

  • Method Details

    • forRecord

      public static <T extends Record> TypeDefinition<T> forRecord(Class<T> recordClass, String primaryType, Map<String,List<TypedDataField>> types)
      Creates a definition for a record type using reflection.

      The extractor function is automatically generated to read record component values using reflection. Component names must match the field names in the type definition.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the record type
      Parameters:
      recordClass - the record class
      primaryType - the primary type name for EIP-712 encoding
      types - map of type names to their field definitions
      Returns:
      a new TypeDefinition with reflection-based extraction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if recordClass is not a record

    • toString

      public final String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this record class. The representation contains the name of the class, followed by the name and value of each of the record components.

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
